instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on the LCD
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image i have cpu vcore  when i measure on pins 18 and 19 on J8300 i should have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD_R</SIGNAL> but i get 0 volts and that took me to <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> so on pin 2 and 3 on <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> i have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> but on pin 1 i should have <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> and that is missing and following that line takes me to the <CHIP>U0500</CHIP>. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on the LCD
threads.message: Does it chime??? You have video on external display???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on the LCD
threads.message: Or easier, does a USB mouse light up?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on the LCD
threads.message: No external video and usb doesn't light up

threads.message: i found another signal missing coming from the cpu <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on the LCD
threads.message: This thing is not even POSTing. No use to look for EDP signals. Need to know where damage was, this could be anything. Obvious is to check around ROM chip, clock chip, SMC first.
